text: with assistance from the members of the
MBA class of
2017 who will introduce each of our
honoraries it is now my pleasure to
present the 2017 alumni achievement
awards I should note that unfortunately
one of our recipients John MacArthur
former dean of har business school is
unable to be with
us his loved colleague here at har
business school Angela Krispy will
accept the award in his behalf let me
now invite Alejandra to the
stage David Bradley connects easily with
all types of people for many years he
thought the realm where he could have
the greatest impact was politics with
his eye on a senate seat he went to
business school and then law school and
set about gaining experience by building
a company the the research Council of
Washington focused on business
research David soon discovered several
things first good research is hard to
find not surprisingly then the research
Council and later its spin-off the
corporate executive board were
enormously
successful second he realized that
politics was not in fact his calling
that led him to his third Discovery
there was a different realm where he
felt he could make a difference and that
realm was media in his words if you
can't take the course you can audit
it in the late 1990s he purchased the
Atlantic a venerable magazine that
seemed to most like a terrible
investment it was losing millions of
dollars a year David saw that building
an online presence for the magazine one
that complemented the print version and
was true to its core principles would
rescue it under his leadership the
Atlantic is now thriving it has won more
National magazine awards than any other
monthly magazine and has a vigorous and
revert digital
presence it is now my honor to present
uh our citation to David Bradley MBA
class of 1977 chairman of Atlantic
media talent scout with a spirit of
generosity and the force of your
intellect you tune out the white noise
to focus on what is
important Visionary adviser and
researcher leaving no stone unturned
your influence reaches Beyond Politics
as you change and save lives David we
honor you and celebrate the ways you
make a difference in the world
[Applause]
Jack Brennan's belief in the power of
Education to transform lives is rooted
in his personal history his grandparents
never finished high school and worked as
janitors and Maids so they could send
their children to college both of his
parents were trained as teachers and
Jack grew up in a household where
getting homework done was the number one
priority education is the road to
success says Jack his own education led
him to Dartmouth and HBS and ultimately
prepared him to lead the Vanguard group
a pioneering firm known for its focus on
lowcost funds for do-it-yourself small
investors
after joining Vanguard in
1982 Jack worked his way through the
ranks expanding vanguard's influence
footprint and success by introducing
index funds as chairman and CEO he was a
passionate advocate for good corporate
governance and honest accounting
striving to rebuild investor confidence
in the wake of stock market
declines a commitment to roll up his
sleeves and help the next generation of
leaders can be seen in everything Jack
does whether that serving as a sounding
board to his successor at Vanguard
working to help Boston high school
students prepare for and stay in college
chairing the board at Notre Dame or
serving in his favorite roles of husband
father and grandfather
John J Brennan MBA class of 1980
chairman emeritus the Vanguard
group coach Mentor leader you bring out
the best in others from the front lines
of Vanguard to the finished lines of
marathons you are living proof hard work
coupled with passion is a powerful force
that can profoundly influence
individuals and Society at large Jack
today we honor you and celebrate the
many ways in which you make a difference
in the
[Applause]
world the story of Angie's List is one
of
perseverance in 1995 the year she
graduated from college Angie Hicks moved
to Columbus Ohio to help help a mentor
test out an idea she rented a tiny
office set up a card table connected a
phone line and set about building a list
of local service providers she spent her
mornings doing research calling local
homeowners to get their recommendations
on painters and
plumbers in the afternoons she'd knock
on doors selling $19 subscriptions to
the list she was
creating I think most of my first
customers felt sorry for me say Hicks
who is not exactly enthusiastic about
approaching
strangers but because she wholeheartedly
believed in the list she was creating
she had the courage to conduct sales
pitch after sales pitch although that
didn't make rejection any easier she
averaged initially only one or two
subscriptions a week but today Angie's
List serves over 5 million members with
an e-commerce Marketplace and reliable
consumer
reviews while Angie might not have
described herself as an entrepreneur
early on she possessed all the qualities
perseverance authenticity and humility
that have led to her company's
remarkable
success they have also LED Angie to be a
leader in the Indianapolis area where
she has put her talents to work
improving jobs and improving educational
opportunities for her community
[Applause]
Angie Hicks MBA class of 2000 co-founder
and chief marketing officer of Ang's
list marketing Maven you have created
jobs and fostered Community while
bringing heart into home with quiet
Brilliance your passion for problem
solving has elevated you to a household
name every day you set an example of
compassionate leadership and the power
of staying true to yourself Angie today
we honor you and celebrate the ways in
which you make a difference in the
[Applause]
world alen Lang became a feminist early
on the valedictorian of her Public High
School she had to settle for vice
president of the class because girls
weren't allowed to be
president at Red Cliff where a dress Cod
required her to wear a skirt she was
told she wasn't smart enough to measure
in
math one of just 33 women in her class
of 800 at
HBS when she graduated she couldn't get
a loan to launch her first business
without her husband's
signature despite these constraints een
excelled
modeling behaviors that broke through
stereotypes an early Pioneer in the
high-tech world she worked in Senior
Management and chief leadership roles at
established corporations and startups
alike including launching and leading
alav Vista one of most successful search
engines of its
time in 2003 e was named president of
catalyst a research and advisory firm
focused on bringing women into business
leadership
roles I like to say that my avocation
has become my job she
noted during a 10-year tenure Catalyst
doubled its Revenue tripled its
membership globalized and adopted
emerging Technologies and the number of
research reports It produced increased
tenfold in all the chapters of her
career een has proved that having
woman at the table is better for
business the bottom line
customers
communities men and
women Eileen H Lang MBA class of
1973 president and CEO of
catalyst consumate Catalyst you have
blazed a trail that is rooted in
Innovation and inclusion you lead by
example mentoring others and modeling
authenticity as you prove that working
together yields profound and Powerful
results Eileen today we celebrate the
many ways in which you make a difference
in the world
John MacArthur came to HBS in
1957 from British
Colombia he earned his MBA and DBA and
then joined the
faculty in 1980 he was named
Dean and driven by his deep love for the
school over the over the next 15 years
he set about quietly and purposefully
transforming it as Dean John brought in
new
faculty renowned Scholars as well as
those who had more practical
experience and urged them to think big
he recruited a more diverse student body
and re-envisioned the MBA
curriculum he launched the publishing
Corporation and grew Executive Education
he perhaps more than anyone made HBS a
true residential campus creating a sense
of place at Soldiers
Field John's influence extends well
beyond HBS he was founding co-chair of
the Board of Trustees of Partners Health
Care
System he has served as senior adviser
to the president of the World Bank and
was a friend to Boston mayor Thomas
minino he was a trustee in bankruptcy
for ofen Central Transportation Company
he has held countless
directorships in everything he does John
connects deeply with people and he is
expert at figuring out what others are
good at and giving them the latitude to
excel
[Applause]
John H
MacArthur NBA
1959 DBA
1963 Dean Emeritus haror business
school legendary leader for 60 years you
have shaped Harvard Business School
strengthening its faculty students and
staff while building its campus and
Community caring contributor proud
Canadian you partner with others in
Boston and abroad to help individuals
and organizations do their best work
today we honor you and celebrate the
many ways in which you exemplify our
mission to make a difference here and in
the world
[Applause]
bio uesi came to HBS to overcome his
aversion to numbers at King's College in
his native Nigeria he had dropped math
he managed to graduate from Oxford
without needing to solve mathematical
equations upon being admitted to Harvard
Law School he decided to embrace what he
had been avoiding he applied to HBS was
accepted and thrived as a student in the
joint degree
program initially bio was intent on
becoming a lawyer he clerked for US
Supreme Court associate Justice thg Good
Marshall a job he completely loved but
his agility with financial statements
kept pushing him towards business he
spent two decades at credit Swiss first
Boston in Project Finance the global
Energy Group and AS Global head of the
investment banking division before being
named chief client officer and chief
executive
chairman throughout his life bio has
pushed himself to reach Beyond his
comfort zone in 2006 eager to try
something new he and several Partners
launched their own firm Global
infrastructure Partners which today
manages over 40 billion for its
investors their expertise at running
large projects including London city and
Gatwick area ports and the port of
Melbourne for example has led to
remarkable
success bio's advice for others is this
have
courage Ado o ogun Lei jdmba
1979 chairman and managing partner
Global infrastructure partners
Oxford Optimist remarkable risk taker
you balance hope with realism merging
Brilliance and hard work to achieve
results and Inspire others Native Sun of
Nigeria the impact of your influence is
felt on a global scale bio today we
honor you and celebrate the many many
ways in which you make the world a
better place
[Applause]
